procedure.title: Installing &abbrev; without user-interaction

indexterm.secondary: from PKG package in silent mode

procedure.para: The &abbrev; application can be installed in silent mode without any user-interaction by specifying the required parameters from the command line. Answers to every question of the installer can be set in advance using command-line parameters.

step.para: Generate a response file that contains the answers to the questions.

warning.para: The pkgask will fail if the response file already exists.

step.para: Run the pkgadd command with the added response file answering y to all questions.

warning.para: pkgask runs the request script of the package under the current condition of the operating system. The installation might fail if something changes (another &abbrev; package has been installed, configuration file has been removed), because the response file's contents will be invalid.
